trans-unit.source: Retrieves information about the system power capabilities

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves information about the system power capabilities

target.mrk: Retrieves information about the system power capabilities

trans-unit.source: The array that contains the following information:

seg-source.mrk: The array that contains the following information:

target.mrk: The array that contains the following information:

trans-unit.source: [0] - If True, there is a system power button.

seg-source.mrk: [0] - If True, there is a system power button.

target.mrk: [0] - If True, there is a system power button.

trans-unit.source: [1] - If True, there is a system sleep button.

seg-source.mrk: [1] - If True, there is a system sleep button.

target.mrk: [1] - If True, there is a system sleep button.

trans-unit.source: [2] - If True, there is a lid switch.

seg-source.mrk: [2] - If True, there is a lid switch.

target.mrk: [2] - If True, there is a lid switch.

trans-unit.source: [3] - If True, the operating system supports sleep state S1.

seg-source.mrk: [3] - If True, the operating system supports sleep state S1.

target.mrk: [3] - If True, the operating system supports sleep state S1.

trans-unit.source: [4] - If True, the operating system supports sleep state S2.

seg-source.mrk: [4] - If True, the operating system supports sleep state S2.

target.mrk: [4] - If True, the operating system supports sleep state S2.

trans-unit.source: [5] - If True, the operating system supports sleep state S3.

seg-source.mrk: [5] - If True, the operating system supports sleep state S3.

target.mrk: [5] - If True, the operating system supports sleep state S3.

trans-unit.source: [6] - If True, the operating system supports sleep state S4 (hibernation).

seg-source.mrk: [6] - If True, the operating system supports sleep state S4 (hibernation).

target.mrk: [6] - If True, the operating system supports sleep state S4 (hibernation).

trans-unit.source: [7] - If True, the operating system supports power off state S5 (soft off).

seg-source.mrk: [7] - If True, the operating system supports power off state S5 (soft off).

target.mrk: [7] - If True, the operating system supports power off state S5 (soft off).

trans-unit.source: [8] - If True, the system hibernation file is present.

seg-source.mrk: [8] - If True, the system hibernation file is present.

target.mrk: [8] - If True, the system hibernation file is present.

trans-unit.source: [9] - If True, the system supports wake capabilities.

seg-source.mrk: [9] - If True, the system supports wake capabilities.

target.mrk: [9] - If True, the system supports wake capabilities.

trans-unit.source: [10] - If True, the system supports video display dimming capabilities.

seg-source.mrk: [10] - If True, the system supports video display dimming capabilities.

target.mrk: [10] - If True, the system supports video display dimming capabilities.

trans-unit.source: [11] - If True, the system supports APM BIOS power management features.

seg-source.mrk: [11] - If True, the system supports APM BIOS power management features.

target.mrk: [11] - If True, the system supports APM BIOS power management features.

trans-unit.source: [12] - If True, there is an uninterruptible power supply (UPS).

seg-source.mrk: [12] - If True, there is an uninterruptible power supply (UPS).

target.mrk: [12] - If True, there is an uninterruptible power supply (UPS).

trans-unit.source: [13] - If True, the system supports thermal zones.

seg-source.mrk: [13] - If True, the system supports thermal zones.

target.mrk: [13] - If True, the system supports thermal zones.

trans-unit.source: [14] - If True, the system supports processor throttling.

seg-source.mrk: [14] - If True, the system supports processor throttling.

target.mrk: [14] - If True, the system supports processor throttling.

trans-unit.source: [15] - The minimum level of system processor throttling supported, expressed as a percentage.

seg-source.mrk: [15] - The minimum level of system processor throttling supported, expressed as a percentage.

target.mrk: [15] - The minimum level of system processor throttling supported, expressed as a percentage.

trans-unit.source: [16] - The maximum level of system processor throttling supported, expressed as a percentage.

seg-source.mrk: [16] - The maximum level of system processor throttling supported, expressed as a percentage.

target.mrk: [16] - The maximum level of system processor throttling supported, expressed as a percentage.

trans-unit.source: [17] - If True, the system supports the hybrid sleep state.

seg-source.mrk: [17] - If True, the system supports the hybrid sleep state.

target.mrk: [17] - If True, the system supports the hybrid sleep state.

trans-unit.source: [18] - If True, the system supports allowing the removal of power to fixed disk devices.

seg-source.mrk: [18] - If True, the system supports allowing the removal of power to fixed disk devices.

target.mrk: [18] - If True, the system supports allowing the removal of power to fixed disk devices.

trans-unit.source: [19] - If True, there are one or more batteries in the system.

seg-source.mrk: [19] - If True, there are one or more batteries in the system.

target.mrk: [19] - If True, there are one or more batteries in the system.

trans-unit.source: [20] - If True, the system batteries are short-term. Short-term batteries are used in uninterruptible power supplies (UPS).

seg-source.mrk: [20] - If True, the system batteries are short-term.
Short-term batteries are used in uninterruptible power supplies (UPS).

target.mrk: [20] - If True, the system batteries are short-term.
Short-term batteries are used in uninterruptible power supplies (UPS).

trans-unit.source: [21] - The lowest system sleep state (Sx) that will generate a wake event when the system is on AC power.

seg-source.mrk: [21] - The lowest system sleep state (Sx) that will generate a wake event when the system is on AC power.

target.mrk: [21] - The lowest system sleep state (Sx) that will generate a wake event when the system is on AC power.

trans-unit.source: [22] - The lowest system sleep state (Sx) that will generate a wake event via the lid switch.

seg-source.mrk: [22] - The lowest system sleep state (Sx) that will generate a wake event via the lid switch.

target.mrk: [22] - The lowest system sleep state (Sx) that will generate a wake event via the lid switch.

trans-unit.source: [23] - The lowest system sleep state (Sx) supported by hardware that will generate a wake event via the RTC.

seg-source.mrk: [23] - The lowest system sleep state (Sx) supported by hardware that will generate a wake event via the RTC.

target.mrk: [23] - The lowest system sleep state (Sx) supported by hardware that will generate a wake event via the RTC.

trans-unit.source: [24] - The minimum allowable system power state supporting wake events.

seg-source.mrk: [24] - The minimum allowable system power state supporting wake events.

target.mrk: [24] - The minimum allowable system power state supporting wake events.

trans-unit.source: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.
